active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the statement: 'All cybersecurity risks have equal business impact and do not require prioritization within ERM.' Use NIST IR 8286 series evidence to support your position, referencing prior knowledge of COSO ERM and basic risk assessment. Identify one common misconception and propose a counterargument.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in 'Cybersecurity Risk Integration with ERM' (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Risk Management Concepts > Organizational and Governance Aspects > Integration with Enterprise Risk Management > Cybersecurity Risk Integration with ERM). Use university pedagogy: Bloom's Taxonomy (objectives provided), active learning (discussion/peer teach/problem-solve), 4-layer scaffolding (Foundation: defs; Components: NIST breakdown; Implementation: steps; Integration: links/optimizations). Prior knowledge: COSO ERM, basic risk ID, cyber basics. Big picture: Unified risks for resilience. Misconceptions: CSRM isolated, equal impacts. Sources: NIST IR 8286 Rev. 1 (https://doi.org/10.6028/NIST.IR.8286r1), IR 8286A Rev. 1 (https://doi.org/10.6028/NIST.IR.8286Ar1), IR 8286B (prioritization, https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/ir/2022/NIST.IR.8286B.pdf), IR 8286C/D (response/reporting); NIST CSF (https://www.nist.gov/cyberframework). Generate 50 high-quality flashcards (10 per Bloom's level from objectives; span scaffolding layers). Follow schema exactly: - Front: Question - Back: {answer: '...', explanation: '... (link objective/layer/active/misconception)', references: '...', misconception_check: '...'} Distractors: Follow protocol (3 per MCQ, misconception-based). Ensure spaced repetition optimization: Varied formats, active recall. Output as JSON array of objects.
